name: 02A-Using-H2O-DRF-Classifying-Patient-Stay
parameters: --var selectDepartment_wf_1='radiotherapy','anesthesia','TB & Chest disease','gynecology','surgery' --var TypeOfAdmission_wf_1='Emergency','Trauma','Urgent' --var SelectHospitalTypeCode_wf_1='a','b','c','d','e','f','g' --var SeverityofIllness_wf_1='Extreme','Minor','Moderate' --var selectDepartment_wf_2='radiotherapy','anesthesia','TB & Chest disease','gynecology','surgery''radiotherapy','anesthesia','TB & Chest disease','gynecology','surgery' --var TypeOfAdmission_wf_2='Emergency','Trauma','Urgent' --var SeverityofIllness_wf_2='Extreme','Minor','Moderate' --var selectmachine=xgb --var workflow_2_featurecolumns=VisitorswithPatient,Ward_Type,BedGrade,TypeofAdmission,AvailableExtraRoomsinHospital,Admission_Deposit,SeverityofIllness,Ward_Facility_Code --var model=test --var selectmachine=drf --var workflow_9_featurecolumns=VisitorswithPatient,Ward_Type,BedGrade,TypeofAdmission,AvailableExtraRoomsinHospital,Admission_Deposit,SeverityofIllness,Ward_Facility_Code --var run1=true

nodes.name: Read CSV
nodes.description: It reads in CSV files and creates a DataFrame from it.
nodes.details:
Read CSV Details


This node reads CSV files and creates a DataFrame from them. It can read either a single file or a directory containing multiple files. The user can configure the below fields to parse the file.

The user can choose the Output storage level from the drop down. The options in the dropdown can be one of the following:
  • MEMORY_ONLY Store RDD as deserialized Java objects in the JVM. If the RDD does not fit in memory, some partitions will not be cached and will be recomputed on the fly each time they are needed. This is the default level.
  • MEMORY_AND_DISK Store RDD as deserialized Java objects in the JVM. If the RDD does not fit in memory, store the partitions that do not fit on disk, and read them from there when they are needed.
  • MEMORY_ONLY_SER Store RDD as serialized Java objects (one byte array per partition). This is generally more space-efficient than deserialized objects, especially when using a fast serializer, but more CPU-intensive to read.
  • MEMORY_AND_DISK_SER Similar to MEMORY_ONLY_SER, but spill partitions that do not fit in memory to disk instead of recomputing them on the fly each time they're needed.
  • DISK_ONLY Store the RDD partitions only on disk.
  • MEMORY_ONLY_2, MEMORY_AND_DISK_2 others . Same as the levels above, but replicate each partition on two cluster nodes.
  • OFF_HEAP Similar to MEMORY_ONLY_SER, but store the data in off-heap memory. This requires off-heap memory to be enabled.
The user needs to provide a data file Path to read the data from. This is a required field.

The user can choose the Separator used in the data file to parse it. The default separator is ( , ) comma.

In the Header field, one can choose:
  • true if the data file has a header.
  • false Otherwise.
In the Drop special character in column name field, one can choose:
  • true If you want to remove the special characters from column names.
  • false Otherwise.
In the Mode field, one can choose from the below options in the dropdown:
  • PERMISSIVE When the parser meets a corrupt field in a record, it sets the value of the field to NULL and continues to the next record.
  • DROPMALFORMED ignores the whole corrupted record.
  • FAILFAST throws an exception when it meets corrupted records.
In the Enforce Schema field, one can choose:
  • true The specified or inferred schema will be forcibly applied to datasource files, and headers in CSV files will be ignored.
  • false The schema will be validated against all headers in CSV files when the header option is set to false.
In the Whether to add input file as a column in DataFrame field, one can choose:
  • true There will be a new column added to the DataFrame at the end, which can be seen in the schema columns. One can enter the name of this column.
  • false This functionality is disabled, and the DataFrame consists of only the columns read from the data file.
In the ENCODING field, one can specify the encoding type to be used for reading the files. By default, it is set as UTF-8.

The QUOTE field sets a single character used for escaping quoted values where the separator can be part of the value. The default value for this is ( " ), a double quote.

The ESCAPE field sets a single character used for escaping quotes inside an already quoted value. The default value for this is ( \ ), a backslash.

After the above options are set, one can click on InferSchema to see the final columns.
Users can still add or delete columns using + button next to the InferSchema and - button next to the column names.
nodes.examples:
Read CSV Node Example


Given a CSV file with the following data:

SupplierID,SupplierName,Region,YearsInBusiness,LeadTime,PriceIndex,OrderFulfillmentTime,OverallCost,OrderCancellations,CustomerRating
S1,Supplier A,Region 1,10,5,1.2,3,100,2,4
S2,Supplier B,Region 2,15,7,1.1,4,120,1,5
If you configure the Read CSV node as follows:

Path: /path/to/your/file.csv
Separator: ,
Header: true
The output would be a DataFrame with the following schema:

Column Name Data Type
SupplierID String
SupplierName String
Region String
YearsInBusiness Integer
LeadTime Integer
PriceIndex Double
OrderFulfillmentTime Integer
OverallCost Integer
OrderCancellations Integer
CustomerRating Integer
nodes.hint: Infer the schema when a new file is selected or the file content has changed

nodes.name: Drop Duplicate Rows
nodes.description: Drops duplicate rows from the incoming DataFrame. Specific columns can be selected to be used when comparing two rows
nodes.details:
This node drops duplicate rows from the incoming DataFrame.

Specific columns can be selected to be used when comparing two rows.

One of the matching rows is included in the outgoing Dataframe.
nodes.examples:
Incoming Dataframe has following rows:

EMP_CD | EMP_NAME | DEPT | AGE
-------------------------------------------------------
E01 | DAVID | HR | 25
E05 | DAVID | HR | 25
E02 | JOHN | SALES | 35
E03 | JOHN | MARKETING | 40
E04 | JOHN | MARKETING | 45

If DropDuplicateRows node is configured to drop duplicate rows having duplicate values in [EMP_NAME] and [DEPT] then outgoing dataframe would be created as below:


EMP_CD | EMP_NAME | DEPT | AGE
-------------------------------------------------------
E02 | JOHN | SALES | 35
E01 | DAVID | HR | 25
E03 | JOHN | MARKETING | 40

If DropDuplicateRows node is configured to drop duplicate rows having duplicate values in [EMP_NAME], [DEPT] and [AGE] then outgoing dataframe would be created as below:


EMP_CD | EMP_NAME | DEPT | AGE
-------------------------------------------------------
E01 | DAVID | HR | 25
E02 | JOHN | SALES | 35
E03 | JOHN | MARKETING | 40
E04 | JOHN | MARKETING | 45

fields.description: Columns to be used in determining if any two rows are duplication. No columns indicate to use all the available columns.

nodes.name: Split
nodes.description: This node splits the incoming DataFrame into 2. It takes in the fraction to use in splitting the data. For example, if the fraction is .7, it would split the data into 2 DataFrames, one containing 70% of the rows(passed from lower edge id to next node) and the other containing the remaining 30%(passed from higher edge id to next node).
nodes.details:
This node splits the incoming DataFrame into 2. It takes in the fraction to use in splitting the data.

For example, if the fraction is .7, it would split the data into 2 DataFrames, one containing 70% of the rows(passed from lower edge id to next node) and the other containing the remaining 30%(passed from higher edge id to next node).

The split node can be used for splitting the DataFrame for training and test datasets used in Machine Learning.
nodes.examples:
lets say you pass a table with 5 rows and the fraction .6(60%),the first and second outcomes of the node will give dataframes as follows

First
PartID SupplierID PartName
StringType StringType StringType
P9271 S798 Part_D
P523 S955 Part_K
P3201 S332 Part_M


Second
PartID SupplierID PartName
StringType StringType StringType
P9634 S527 Part_G
P9345 S850 Part_M

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: fraction1
fields.title: Fraction 1
fields.description: Fraction to be used for Splitting the DataFrame into two. The first DataFrame would go to the lower edge output. The other would go to the higher edge output.

nodes.name: H2O Distributed Random Forest
nodes.description: Distributed Random Forest (DRF) is a powerful classification and regression tool. DRF generates a forest of classification or regression trees.
nodes.details:
Distributed Random Forest (DRF) is a powerful classification and regression tool. When given a set of data, DRF generates a forest of classification or regression trees, rather than a single classification or regression tree. Each of these trees is a weak learner built on a subset of rows and columns. More trees will reduce the variance. Both classification and regression take the average prediction over all of their trees to make a final prediction, whether predicting for a class or numeric value.

More details are available at : docs.h2o.ai/h2o/latest-stable/h2o-docs/data-science/drf.html
nodes.examples:
Input:
Label Column: "HousePrice"
Feature Columns: ["Bedrooms", "SquareFootage", "Neighborhood"]
Output:
A Random Forest model trained to predict house prices.
The output includes feature importance scores, helping identify the most influential predictors.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: isResponseIsCategorical
fields.title: Is Response Column Categorical
fields.description: Specify a response column type(numeric or categorical). Separates the Classification and Regression

fields.name: labelCol
fields.title: Label Column
fields.description: Response variable column.

fields.name: featuresCols
fields.title: Feature Columns
fields.description: Features to be used for Modelling

fields.name: path
fields.title: Path
fields.description: Save Confusion Matrix to Path

fields.name: columnsToCategorical
fields.title: Columns to Categorical
fields.description: Columns to be Categorical encoded

fields.name: seed
fields.title: Seed
fields.description: Seed for pseudo random number generator (if applicable).

fields.name: balanceClasses
fields.title: Balance Classes
fields.description: Balance training data class counts via over/under-sampling (for imbalanced data).

fields.name: nfolds
fields.title: Number of Folds
fields.description: Number of folds for K-fold cross-validation (0 to disable or >= 2).

fields.name: ntrees
fields.title: Number of Trees
fields.description: Number of trees.

fields.name: maxDepth
fields.title: Max Depth
fields.description: Maximum tree depth (0 for unlimited).

fields.name: minRows
fields.title: Min Rows
fields.description: Fewest allowed (weighted) observations in a leaf.

fields.name: nbins
fields.title: Number of Bins
fields.description: For numerical columns (real/int), build a histogram of (at least) this many bins, then split at the best point.

fields.name: nbinsTopLevel
fields.title: Number of bins top level
fields.description: For numerical columns (real/int), build a histogram of (at most) this many bins at the root level, then decrease by factor of two per level.

fields.name: nbinsCats
fields.title: Number of Bins Categoricals
fields.description: For categorical columns (factors), build a histogram of this many bins, then split at the best point. Higher values can lead to more overfitting.

fields.name: categoricalEncoding
fields.title: Categorical Encoding
fields.description: Specify one of the various encoding schemes for handling categorical features

fields.name: ignoreConstCols
fields.title: Ignore Const Columns
fields.description: Ignore constant columns.

fields.name: scoreEachIteration
fields.title: Score Each Iteration
fields.description: Whether to score during each iteration of model training.

fields.name: stoppingRounds
fields.title: Stopping Rounds
fields.description: Early stopping based on convergence of stopping_metric. Stop if simple moving average of length k of the stopping_metric does not improve for k:=stopping_rounds scoring events (0 to disable).

fields.name: maxRuntimeSecs
fields.title: Max Runtime Secs
fields.description: his argument specifies the maximum time that the AutoML process will run for. If both max_runtime_secs and max_models are specified, then the AutoML run will stop as soon as it hits either of these limits. If neither max_runtime_secs nor max_models are specified, then max_runtime_secs defaults to 3600 seconds (1 hour).

fields.name: stoppingMetric
fields.title: StoppingMetric
fields.description: Metric to use for early stopping (AUTO: logloss for classification, deviance for regression)

fields.name: stoppingTolerance
fields.title: StoppingTolerance
fields.description: Relative tolerance for metric-based stopping criterion (stop if relative improvement is not at least this much)

fields.name: gainsliftBins
fields.title: Gains Lift Bins
fields.description: Gains/Lift table number of bins. 0 means disabled.. Default value -1 means automatic binning.

fields.name: withContributions
fields.title: With Contributions
fields.description: Enables or disables generating a sub-column of detailedPredictionCol containing Shapley values.

fields.name: convertUnknownCategoricalLevelsToNa
fields.title: Convert Unknown Categorical Levels to NA
fields.description: If set to ‘true’, the model converts unknown categorical levels to NA during making predictions.

fields.name: predictionCol
fields.title: Prediction Column
fields.description: Prediction column name

fields.name: detailedPredictionCol
fields.title: Detailed Prediction column
fields.description: Column containing additional prediction details, its content depends on the model type

fields.name: withLeafNodeAssignments
fields.title: With Node Assignments
fields.description: Enables or disables computation of leaf node assignments.

fields.name: withStageResults
fields.title: With Stage Results
fields.description: Enables or disables computation of stage results.

fields.name: mtries
fields.title: mtries
fields.description: Number of variables randomly sampled as candidates at each split. If set to -1, defaults to sqrt{p} for classification and p/3 for regression (where p is the # of predictors.

fields.name: binomialDoubleTrees
fields.title: Binomial Double trees
fields.description: For binary classification: Build 2x as many trees (one per class) - can lead to higher accuracy.

fields.name: sampleRate
fields.title: Sample Rate
fields.description: Row sample rate per tree (from 0.0 to 1.0).

fields.name: maxAfterBalanceSize
fields.title: Max After Balance Size
fields.description: Maximum relative size of the training data after balancing class counts (can be less than 1.0). Requires balance_classes.

fields.name: maxConfusionMatrixSize
fields.title: Max Confusion Matrix Size
fields.description: [Deprecated] Maximum size (# classes) for confusion matrices to be printed in the Logs.

fields.name: buildTreeOneNode
fields.title: Build tree one node
fields.description: Enables to run on a single node

fields.name: colSampleRatePerTree
fields.title: Column Sample Rate Per Tree (from 0.0 to 1.0).
fields.description: Column sample rate per tree (from 0.0 to 1.0).

fields.name: colSampleRateChangePerLevel
fields.title: Column Sample Rate change Per Level
fields.description: Relative change of the column sampling rate for every level (must be > 0.0 and <= 2.0).

fields.name: scoreTreeInterval
fields.title: Score Tree Interval
fields.description: Score the model after every so many trees. Disabled if set to 0.

fields.name: histogramType
fields.title: Histogram Type
fields.description: What type of histogram to use for finding optimal split points. Possible values are

fields.name: calibrateModel
fields.title: Calibrate Model
fields.description: Use Platt Scaling to calculate calibrated class probabilities. Calibration can provide more accurate estimates of class probabilities.

fields.name: checkConstantResponse
fields.title: Check Constant Response
fields.description: UCheck if response column is constant. If enabled, then an exception is thrown if the response column is a constant value.If disabled, then model will train regardless of the response column being a constant value or not.

fields.name: keepCrossValidationModels
fields.title: Keep Cross Validation Models
fields.description: Whether to keep the cross-validated models. Keeping cross-validation models may consume significantly more memory in the H2O cluster.

fields.name: keepCrossValidationPredictions
fields.title: Keep Cross Validation Predictions
fields.description: Whether to keep the predictions of the cross-validation predictions. This needs to be set to TRUE if running the same AutoML object for repeated runs because CV predictions are required to build additional Stacked Ensemble models in AutoML.

fields.name: keepCrossValidationFoldAssignment
fields.title: Keep Cross Validation Fold Assignment
fields.description: Whether to keep cross-validation assignments.

fields.name: distribution
fields.title: Distribution
fields.description: Distribution function used by algorithms that support it; other algorithms use their defaults.

fields.name: weightCol
fields.title: Weight Column
fields.description: Column with observation weights. Giving some observation a weight of zero is equivalent to excluding it from the dataset; giving an observation a relative weight of 2 is equivalent to repeating that row twice. Negative weights are not allowed. Note: Weights are per-row observation weights and do not increase the size of the data frame. This is typically the number of times a row is repeated, but non-integer values are supported as well. During training, rows with higher weights matter more, due to the larger loss function pre-factor. If you set weight = 0 for a row, the returned prediction frame at that row is zero and this is incorrect. To get an accurate prediction, remove all rows with weight == 0.

fields.name: offsetCol
fields.title: Offset Column
fields.description: Offset column. This will be added to the combination of columns before applying the link function.

fields.name: foldCol
fields.title: Fold Column
fields.description: Column with cross-validation fold index assignment per observation.

fields.name: foldAssignment
fields.title: Fold Assignment
fields.description: Cross-validation fold assignment scheme, if fold_column is not specified. The 'Stratified' option will stratify the folds based on the response variable, for classification problems.

fields.name: aucType
fields.title: AUC Type
fields.description: Set default multinomial AUC type.

fields.name: output_confusion_matrix_chart
fields.title: Output Confusion Matrix Chart
fields.description: whether to display confusion matrix chart.

fields.name: cm_chart_title
fields.title: Confusion Matrix Chart Title
fields.description: Title name to display in Confusion Matrix Chart

fields.name: cm_chart_description
fields.value: Visual Representation of Predicted vs. Actual Classes
fields.title: Confusion Matrix Chart Description
fields.description: Description to display in Confusion Matrix CHart

fields.name: confusionMatrixTargetLegend
fields.title: Confusion Matrix Target Legend
fields.description: Legend name to display for Target in Confusion Matrix

fields.name: confusionMatrixPredictedLabelLegend
fields.title: Confusion Matrix PredictedLabel Legend
fields.description: Legend name to display for Predicted Label in Confusion Matrix

fields.name: output_roc_curve
fields.title: Output ROC Curve
fields.description: Whether to display confusion matrix chart.

fields.name: roc_title
fields.title: ROC Curve Chart Title
fields.description: Title name to display in ROC Curve Chart

fields.name: roc_description
fields.title: ROC Curve Chart Description
fields.description: Add Description for ROC Curve Chart

fields.name: xlabel
fields.title: X Label
fields.description: X label

fields.name: ylabel
fields.title: Y Label
fields.description: Y Label

fields.name: paramKeys
fields.title: Param Name
fields.description: Param Names. eg: maxDepth ,learnRate, nTrees

fields.name: paramValues
fields.title: Param Value
fields.description: Param Values. eg: 4,5,6

fields.name: gridStrategy
fields.title: Grid Search Strategy
fields.description: Strategy to use for model hyperparameter search. Cartesian does exhaustive search; RandomDiscrete searches randomly within given time or model limits.

fields.name: gridMaxModels
fields.title: Grid Max Models
fields.description: Maximum number of models to build in the grid search (0 for unlimited).

fields.name: gridMaxRuntimeSecs
fields.title: Grid Max Runtime Seconds
fields.description: Maximum runtime in seconds for the grid search (0 for unlimited).

fields.name: gridStoppingRounds
fields.title: Grid Stopping Rounds
fields.description: Early stopping based on convergence of the metric during grid search (0 to disable).

fields.name: gridStoppingTolerance
fields.title: Grid Stopping Tolerance
fields.description: Tolerance for metric-based stopping criterion during grid search.

fields.name: gridStoppingMetric
fields.title: Grid Stopping Metric
fields.description: Metric to use for early stopping during grid search (AUTO: logloss for classification, deviance for regression).

fields.name: gridParallelism
fields.title: Grid Parallelism
fields.description: Level of parallelism to use when building models in the grid.

fields.name: gridSelectBestModelBy
fields.title: Grid Select Best Model By
fields.description: Metric used to select the best model from the grid.

nodes.name: H2O Score
nodes.details:
H2O Score Node


This node scores a new dataset using an existing H2O model. It takes a trained H2O model and an input DataFrame as input and generates predictions.
nodes.examples:
H2O Score Node Example


Scenario:

Let's say you have trained an H2O model to predict customer churn. You can use the H2O Score node to apply this model to a new dataset of customer data and generate churn predictions.

Configuration:

1. **H2O Model:** Select the trained H2O model to use for scoring from model load node
2. **Output Storage Level:** Choose the storage level for the output DataFrame.

Output:

The node will output a new DataFrame containing the original input data along with the predicted values.

fields.description: To enable the test metrics.

fields.description: Compute Shapley Values and it supported for Regression and Binomial Classification problem.

fields.name: path
fields.title: Path
fields.description: Path to save the Shapley contributions for test dataset.

fields.name: modelType
fields.title: Model Type
fields.description: Select the type of the model.

nodes.name: Print N Rows
nodes.description: Prints the specified number of records in the DataFrame. It is useful for seeing intermediate output
nodes.details:
Print N Rows Node Details


This node is used to print the first N rows from the incoming dataframe.

The Number of rows that needs to be printed can be configured in the node.

Input Parameters

  • OUTPUT STORAGE LEVEL : Keep this as DEFAULT.
  • TITLE : Enter a short description for the type of information being displayed.
  • NUM ROWS TO PRINT : Set an integer value(N) which controls the number of rows to be displayed(Default N=10).
  • DISPLAY DATA TYPE : Shows the output dataframe column datatypes by default.

Output

  • This node can be used to view, analyze and validate the output of the Dataframe.
nodes.examples:
when input 5 in no of rows,it will show first 5 rows of the table as follows

PartID SupplierID PartName

P9271 S798 Part_D
P523 S955 Part_K
P3201 S332 Part_M
P9634 S527 Part_G
P9345 S850 Part_M

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: n
fields.title: Num Rows to Print
fields.description: number of rows to be printed

fields.name: displayDataType
fields.title: Display Data Type
fields.description: If true display rows DataType

nodes.name: Select Columns
nodes.description: This node creates a new DataFrame that contains only the selected columns
nodes.details:
Select Columns Node Details


This node creates a new DataFrame containing only the selected columns.

It selects columns that need to be passed to the outgoing Dataframe.

Columns that need to be included in the outgoing Dataframe are to be selected in the 'Selected' list. Multiple columns can be selected in the list.
nodes.examples:
Select Columns Node Examples


Incoming Dataframe


In this example we have considered an Incoming Dataframe with following rows:

CUST_CD | CUST_NAME | AGE | DATE_OF_JOINING | SALARY
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
C01 | MATT | 50 | 12-02-2002 | USD 200000.00
C02 | LISA | 45 | 15-11-2020 | GBP 100000.00
C03 | ROBIN | 30 | 10-10-2015 | EUR 15000.00
C04 | MARCUS | 35 | 01-01-2021 | AUD 350000.00

Select Columns Node Configuration And Output


[CUST_CD], [CUST_NAME] and [SALARY] columns from the incoming Dataframe are selected to be part of the outgoing Dataframe.
Outgoing Dataframe would be created as below containing only the selected columns:

CUST_CD | CUST_NAME | SALARY
-------------------------------------------------
C01 | MATT | USD 200000.00
C02 | LISA | GBP 100000.00
C03 | ROBIN | EUR 15000.00
C04 | MARCUS | AUD 350000.00

fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: outputCols
fields.title: Columns
fields.description: Columns to be included in the output DataFrame

nodes.name: Save CSV
nodes.description: Saves the DataFrame into the specified location in CSV Format
nodes.details: This node saves incoming Dataframe into the specified location in CSV format.
nodes.examples:
path-folder1/folder2/filename

the file will be saved under the file name at the path provided
if folder is not present it will be created and save the file
if the file already exists selection in save mode determines what happens to the file,append-adds the file data to it overwrite-replaces the file altogether

nodes.name: Row Filter
nodes.description: This node creates a new DataFrame containing the rows that satisfy the given condition
nodes.details:
Details


Row filter allows the user to filter out rows that do not meet a set condition. Rows that meet the condition are passed on to the next node in a new dataframe.
nodes.examples:
Examples of Conditional Expression


Below are some examples of the Conditions Expression which can be used.

  • col1 > 5 AND col2 > 3
  • name is not NULL
  • name is NULL
  • usd_pledged_real > 0 and (category = "Narrative Film" or category == "Music") and goal > 100
  • dt > '2021-09-03' (dt column is of type date)
  • datetime > '2011-01-01 00:00:00.0' (datetime column is of type timestamp)
  • datetime > '2011-01-01 00:00:00.0' and datetime < '2016-01-01 00:00:00.0'

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: conditionExpr
fields.value:
Department in (${selectDepartment_wf_2}) and
TypeofAdmission in (${TypeOfAdmission_wf_2}) and
SeverityofIllness in(${SeverityofIllness_wf_2})
fields.title: Conditional Expression
fields.description: The filtering condition. Rows not satisfying given condition will be excluded from output DataFrame. eg: usd_pledged_real > 0 and (category = 1 or category == 2) and goal > 100
